reviewText: After watching Ip Man, I fell in love with Wing Chun Kung Fu and wanted to know more about the origin of the art - when low and behold a movie with the most simple title comes out - first I watched it online, and knew immediately I had to purchase it to I can bring my friends over to watch. Besides having the facts or storyline down pact, it's a great movie on it's own. It makes you feel happy, sad, angry and laughter every other scene - it's a really great informational film with serious action and surprisingly serious tone half way onwards - great movie 10/10!

what a great picture true story fight scenes are incredible the only reason why i didn't rate it a 5 star is because it wasn't in english and its not in blue ray that was dissapointing but what a great movie

While you could call this a remake of Wing Chun with Michelle Yeoh, it is a much more lighthearted film, much closer to a romantic comedy. Maybe even a little closer to the traditional story of Yim Wing Chun. Jing Bai is adorable as the title character. Yuen Wah and Yuen Qiu (the landlords from Kung Fu Hustle) add some slapstick moments. I enjoyed this much more than I thought I would.

Very enjoyable film although the original version is still my favorite.  Seems to use actual wing chun choreography although I am not a wing chun practitioner so take that opinion for what it is worth.  DVD quality good.  I prefer native language with subtitles and this version delivered as described.  Outtakes at the end were unexpected and great fun.
